zone.line: Both infinite as is this Universe
And thou, & thy self torturing solitude.
An awful Image of calm power
Though now thou s{i}ttest, let the hour
Come, when thou must appear to be
That which thou art internally
And after many a false & fruitless crime
Scorn track thy lagging fall thro boundless
{S}pace & time.
the Phantasm vanishes
Prometheus
Were these my words o Parent?
The Earth
They were thine
Prometheus
It doth repent me: words are quick & vain;
Grief for awhile is blind, & so was mine
I wish no living thing to suffer pain.

line.del: he bends his head as in pain

zone.line: The Earth
Misery o misery to me
That Jove at length should vanquish
thee
